text: This game being almost 10 years old makes me feel like an old man. One of the first amazing indie games I've played. It worked perfectly with the Wiimote and the game's atmosphere was only matched by its awesome levels. The developer 2D Boy made a few other games since, but nothing ever came close to World of Goo's brilliance.
author: SupraDarky

text: SupraDarky I adore Little Inferno, this looks scarier...
author: Philip J. Fry II

text: Aha! Finally a World of Goo track. All three of the OSTs he's done (this, Little Inferno, and Human Resource Machine) are absolutely incredible and nearly every track from them is worthy of this list - I'm surprised this hasn't been featured more.
author: K.T.B.

text: 10 years old. Wow, when I think about it how I played it for the first time on the PC. The time runs

text: I got my Wii ten years ago and that freaks me out
author: Incognito D

text:
I want to see the best in the world.
I want to face the end of it with pride, knowing me and my dearest friends have lived good lives.
but I can't.
I know, deep down, the world will never better itself. it will just keep getting worse and worse and I'm scared that one day I'll be waiting for them, not knowing that they've been killed, whether by somebody else or by themselves. I just want to know I don't have to worry... but I know I have to... I don't want them to die without me....

I just want to see them at least one more time before they die...



I just want them to be happy... and free...
but thanks to the fact that nobody trusts each other anymore....

that will NEVER happen.
author: sarah knight
